description: Central slider engine for Leafs Dynasty AI. Stores default 0–10 values for offensive and defensive line sliders, using only NHL 25 options from Austin's screenshots.

forward_line.offensive_strategy: string (Overload | Behind The Net | Crash The Net | Balanced)

defaults.notes: These are Canon v5 baseline values. Match the in-game 0–10 sliders. Dynasty GPT can shift them per matchup, but Architect GPT must always start from here.

elite_scorer.notes: Use for Matthews/Nylander-type lines. Puck possession + shot volume.

playmaker_cycle.notes: Use when you want longer cycles and low plays from behind the net.

checking_shutdown.notes: Matchup line vs top opponents. Prioritizes energy and shot blocking.

energy_heavy.notes: Fourth-line template for physical, momentum-type units.

offensive_pair.notes: Use when your D pair can safely pinch and join the cycle.

balanced_pair.notes: Standard default for most second pairs.

shutdown_pair.notes: Safer blue-line behavior for late leads or weaker skating pairs.

architect_gpt.notes: Architect can adjust these defaults between versions (v5.1, v5.2) but must always keep values within 0–10 and only use the sliders defined here.

dynasty_gpt.notes: Leafs Dynasty GPT can temporarily move these sliders for specific matchups (e.g., vs DET) but should report any changes in its gameplan exports.
